get.description: This API resource provides information about many buildings on campus. It can be used to get building information such as Name, Category, Address, Square Footage, Year Built, and GPS coordinates of every place on campus.
get.x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: Validate query string parameters and headers

get.description: Return all possible categories for buildings.
Return all buildings of a specified category.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the building to be returned.

get.description: Return all types of demand for all buildings
Search for information on a Building's sensors by name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of demand. Energy, Electric, Heating, etc.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The day related to the data to be returned. Must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

get.description: Return the demand for a specific hour of a building and demand type.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of demand. Energy, Electric, Heating, etc.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date you would like to return. Must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

get.description: Returns announcements related to transit information
Returns a set of stops for each bus route, along with information related to each stop.
Return a transit route by id

parameters.name: route_id
parameters.description: The route id for a transit route

responseTemplates.application/json:
##  See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-mapping-template-reference.html
##  This template will pass through all parameters including path, querystring, header, stage variables, and context through to the integration endpoint via the body/payload
#set($allParams = $input.params())
#foreach($elem in $input.path('$.routes'))
#if($elem.id == $input.params('route_id'))
#set($routes = $elem)
#end
#end
{
    "routes": 
        {
        "agency_id": $routes.agency_id,
        "bounds": $routes.bounds,
        "color": "$routes.color",
        "description": "$routes.description",
        "id": $routes.id,
        "is_active": $routes.is_active,
        "long_name": "$routes.long_name",
        "short_name": "$routes.short_name",
        "text_color": "$routes.text_color",
        "type": "$routes.type",
        "url": "$routes.url"
        }
}

get.description: Returns routes with their respective segments. Segment location data is stored using Google's Encoded Polyline Algorithm Format
Get vehicle information by designated id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID related to a vehicle

responseTemplates.application/json:
##  See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/api-gateway-mapping-template-reference.html
##  This template will pass through all parameters including path, querystring, header, stage variables, and context through to the integration endpoint via the body/payload
#set($allParams = $input.params())
#foreach($elem in $input.path('$.vehicles'))
#if($elem.id == $input.params('id'))
#set($bus = $elem)
#end
#end
{
    "success": $input.path('$.success'), 
    "vehicles": 
        {
            "agency_id": $bus.agency_id,
            "apc_status": "$bus.apc_status",
            "call_name": $bus.call_name,
            "current_stop_id": $bus.current_stop_id,
            "heading": $bus.heading,
            "id": $bus.id,
            "load": $bus.load,
            "num_cars": $bus.num_cars,
            "position": $bus.position,
            "route_id": $bus.route_id,
            "segment_id": $bus.segment_id,
            "speed": $bus.speed,
            "timestamp": $bus.timestamp
        }
}
